verse_content.Sanskrit:
अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता ।
सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥ ३२ ॥
verse_content.Transliteration:
adharmam dharmam iti yā
manyate tamasāvṛtā
sarvārthān viparītāmś ca
buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
verse_content.Word_by_word: adharmam—irreligion; dharmam—religion; iti—thus; yā—which; manyate—thinks; tamasā—by illusion; āvṛtā—covered; sarva-arthān—all things; viparītān—the wrong direction; ca—also; buddhih—intelligence; sa—that; pārtha—O son of Pṛthā; tāmasī—the mode of ignorance.
verse_content.Translation: That understanding which considers irreligion to be religion and religion to be irreligion, under the spell of illusion and darkness, and strives always in the wrong direction, O Pārtha, is in the mode of ignorance.
